website_summaries.verdict: One of the best broadheads for better reliability and results when hunting with a crossbow.
pros: Comes with a 2-blade design, each with a 2-inch cutting surface for extra damage and reliability
Fits to any 1-inch arrow tube by simply screwing on for a tight fit
cons: Blades can fail to deploy in tougher hides such as deer flesh

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT COME WITH PRACTICE BROADHEAD.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used these yet so I don't want to give a false review; however, this item does not come with practice broadhead as the product description states. Very unfortunate as I needed the practice head this week to sight my bow in.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson Bailey

customer_reviews.title: These things are great
customer_reviews.text: Good price and they work GREAT! I took my first trophy quality buck with the 100 grain head. I do need to get replacement blades and such, so I don't have to buy a bunch more heads. The two inch wound went all the way through and had my buck bleeding out within 50 yards. I was truly amazed. I know some folks swear by other broad heads, but I'm happy with these. The fact that they come with a practice head makes it even more of a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: No practice tip as stated
customer_reviews.text: There is no practice tip in this package at all. Not once but twice delivered and no practice tip. So I just shoot my tip into a target to see the trajectory!? I think not. Got to either buy the same grain practice tips or get lucky..
customer_reviews.author: AdamH101

customer_reviews.title: Bro, it devastates
customer_reviews.text: Bro, you want an exciting sight just buy these bad boys. When this thing hits the unlucky beast your shootin at it sounds like you and your buddie high fived out the the window of two trucks passing each other at over 100 miles an hour. Better hope that the deer isn’t on your moms new carpet either because after two steps the blood trail looks like you tried to run Niagra falls through a garden hose. Your blind grandma could throw a football though the entrance and exit wounds from a quarter of a continent away. If you are looking for broadheads, stop, you have found the one.
customer_reviews.author: E Jay Zuspan III

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Fly great, they just don't open. Shooting around 375 FPS, and not opening. Lost a nice Doe from 33 yards. Went through and through, and she bounded off through the field. No bloodtrail, just a couple spots on the ground. Lost sight of her about 250 yards away, and couldn't find and blood to track into the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Canoe Tribal HQ

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 packs of these. I have had some accuracy issue's. I have lost one deer with these which has me really wondering about mechanical broadheads again. I have only lost 2 deer in my lifetime of hunting. The very first deer with a traditional bow and now the first deer with a crossbow. both using mechanical broadheads. I did manage to kill deer with these since than but still question there durability while slicing thru bone/ribs.I only use fixed blade with my traditional bow now. I just bought out Wal-Mart who had them on clearance for $9 dollars a pack. Seeing that I will never pay the price I paid on Amazon Again!!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with a practice tip but Amazon made it right
customer_reviews.text: The listing clearly states that the 3 pack of broadheads comes with a practice tip. It does not. *UPDATE* - Since I bought this through Amazon, they issued me a $20 credit for anything sold by Amazon. I used it to purchase a 3 pack of the practice tips. Big props to Amazon for rectifying the issue. I haven't had a chance to shoot these yet. Once I have, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Someguy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these for a crossbow
customer_reviews.text: I have lost a deer because of these broad heads did not open on impact. I had my reservations about Rage, and now I can say it was justified. Stay away, no matter what the other say, I am now a member of the hunters that made a prefect shot and the rage broad head failed and the deer was lost.
customer_reviews.author: Heavenly Harvest Homestead

customer_reviews.title: Blades did not deploy
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would try these, despite the negative reviews. I wasted my money. Yes, they are accurate. No, the blades did not deploy on impact when shooting at targets. I shot at my Big Block and my 3D deer target. The blades did not open on either one until about the seventh shot. This is not a chance I want to take when shooting at that buck of a lifetime, or any other game animal. I never hunted with them and now they just sit as a backup in case I run out of my fixed blades (which never fail).
customer_reviews.author: Buckhunter

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the small metal spacer
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said before me, these broadheads are amazing. Just took my first doe with my Barnett Whitetail Pro STR. I was shooting Carbon Express Maxima Headhunters with the 125 grain Rage Broadhead. The point of impact was spot on and the blood trail was huge. She made it about 40 yards before collapsing. One thing to note is on the 125 grain version there is a small metal washer/spacer that goes under the shock collar. I didn't see it mentioned anywhere on the package or in any of the pictures but these only weigh about 118 grains without it.
customer_reviews.author: William Hatley

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: No instructions came with the package. First time using this type of arrow. Frustrated with typical broadheads not performing in a gentle breeze. On the first day, which was pretty windy here, I downed a nice doe at 45 yards. Bolt went all the way through, blades extended and cut a nifty two inch channel all the way through. Worked as desired. Haven't found the bolt yet, when I do I'll post a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Johnsen

customer_reviews.title: These broadheads are the best.....
customer_reviews.text: These broadheads are the only ones that I will use. Used these broadheads on a recent trip to Africa. They we used to take three impalas, two warthogs, a wildebeest and a zebra. All shots were between 25 and 40 yards. All shots were clean, pass thru shots. None of the animals ran for more than 50 yards! Amust for your crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Ray G. Varner

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order
customer_reviews.text: They sent me a different broadhead than the one pictured. Additionally, the description says it includes a practice broadhead but none was included. I’ve used Rage for a long time and never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: incourt

customer_reviews.title: very sharp but...
customer_reviews.text: These do not engage upon impact, had to use vice grips to forceably open the blades while tightened onto my bolts in order to weaken the spacers. The spacers have built in notches that are supposed to allow the blades to open but instead of a flexible plastic, they are a harder plastic. the blades themselves have a notch where they meet the spacer and the notch depth is deeper than the spacers' notches which also adds to the problem. Not enough surface area catches the blades bases to unseat the blades in their locked position unless the spacers are significantly weakened. I'm sure if i hit shoulder blade they will deploy but I'm not aiming at shoulder blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, reliable, and lethal
customer_reviews.text: They work perfectly. I've shot multiple deer using these broadheads, and I've had zero problems tracking them. In fact, I don't recall any deer running more than 20 yards. Sighting a bow in using the practice tip translates perfectly into accuracy out of the stand. If you put in countless hours chasing big game, then buying the right broadhead is imperative. These broadheads perform every single time.
customer_reviews.author: Tee_rox

customer_reviews.title: Best out there!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to order additional broad heads because I got lucky this year and harvested a large white tail. When I recovered the deer, just a short distance away, I noticed the cutting diameter of these things. These broad heads worked perfectly, opening up properly and administered a huge 2 inch hold in the rib cage cutting right through the rib bone. The blades were warped and bent afterwards but that's completely expected, it did it's job!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great if shock collar put on correctly
customer_reviews.text: Vitally important that the shock collar(plastic ring) be put on correctly. Blades should NOT line up with notches in shock collar. Blades need to line up central to "petals" (half way between notches). That way blades will deploy correctly and massive hemorrhaging will occur ensuring a swift ethical kill.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty "meh" at best.
customer_reviews.text: If used as directed the blades most likely won't deploy and that is from crossbow shooting in excess of 350 fps. Poor design from rage. You can manually pop blades thru the locking collar a few times by using a flathead screwdriver. Then once there is somewhat of a notch the blades should deploy. Would recommend NAP doublecross spitfire over this. I know great hunters that love the company, but I'm missing all the rage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This was the first mechanical broadhead I’ve used. I was totally impressed with the flight and cutting of the braodhead. A 30 yard shot yielded a large entry and exit wound resulting in a less than 60 second kill taking out both lungs and heart. As a follow-up; second deer harvested. Quick kill, rapid bleed out, large wound. I am going to get another set.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Accurate however not very durable but the do the job atleast once. 3 pack has taken out 2 coyotes and a whitetail buck this year and not one of them is usable without replacing the tips and blades on 2 of them and the other one is completely shot as it bent the shaft. 2 of them hit a rock after the pass thru but one must of hit bone before passing thru and laying on the ground. Shot the standard 2 blade Rages before and never had issues this bad before switching to the crossbowX. Going to try the Hypodermics stainless steel to see if their more durable.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: 2 inch entry and exit.
customer_reviews.text: Love em. Shot about 10 whitetail in the last 4 years with rage.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!!!!! NOT a genuine Rage product!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When the product arrived it looked fine, but there was no practice head included. I contacted Rage customer service who informed me that they no longer make these practice heads and any listing promising free practice heads are NOT genuine Rage listings. I will be returning the product and buying elsewhere to be sure I get the genuine product. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Cutters!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is my third year with this set. Probaly 12 deer. I just replace the blades if they are too bent to sharpen. These things are awsome. One shot I did, tracking was soo easy to follow. Big cut. One shot was a quartering away shot and the entrance and exit wound was at least 4 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Clay C.

customer_reviews.title: Rage in the cage baby !
customer_reviews.text: It's all about the 2 blade rage's for me. Leaves great blood trails and found it to be a great product !!
customer_reviews.author: BenK

customer_reviews.title: So-so for older slower bows
customer_reviews.text: These are actually great broadheads and they make a blood trail like I've never seen before. They fly true and I've never had one fail to open. I'm only rating 4 stars because my older Horton crossbow lacks the speed to push these broadheads clear through bone and innards. Other broadheads go clean through, but these always tend to get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: More than anything else, I hate my time being wasted
customer_reviews.text: Both times I ordered package did not include practice head as described!! Kept one to have tips on hand, but returning the other. Hopefully they fly close enough to field point... Please fix product description. Very much false advertising and now I have to take time out of my day and go through the hassle to return this. Not satisfied so far and haven’t even used...
customer_reviews.author: BlueEyesWhiteMullet

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 are good
customer_reviews.text: I received these with one of the tips missing a set screw has wings and band but no screw it was very odd i looked to see if it was in package but no, even tho i knew should be missing. Im a disabled vet who uses a crossbow and love these tips just wish i could get a replacement but guess ill have to settle for 2 of them i hope seller can contact me for a replacement. Thank you so much wish i could rate higher they are nice but 1 is missing hardware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flies like a field point. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: These broad heads are very well built and do the job. I took down a very nice doe with these. Arrow passed through and the blood trail was huge. Flies like a field point. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gooser

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead that packs a punch.
customer_reviews.text: These broadheads are by far some of the best I have shot. They pack plenty of punch on whitetail deer. I have shot them through "shoot through" mesh on my blind without any problems. I've had no failures to open so far. Only problem I have is that they are basically one and done. Most of the time after shooting a deer the blades will be bent,but they do sell replacement blades and they are easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description
customer_reviews.text: Description reads: "Includes free practice head to ensure you will be on target when it counts!" That was incorrect. No practice broadhead was included. If it wasn't for the sale price of $22, I would definitely be returning these. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great broadheads but
customer_reviews.text: It states that these broad heads come with a practice tip. My package did not include a practice tip. These are excellent broad heads, but the advertising is misleading. You can not expect these to shoot the same as your practice tips without shooting them with the practice tip that was supposedly supposed to be included.
customer_reviews.author: Preconnect

customer_reviews.title: Don’t open on whitetail
customer_reviews.text: Junk, didn’t open , I shot a doe and the blades didn’t open until hitting the ground after a full pass through, this has happened to me twice over the years .I’ll stick with fixpandables for now
customer_reviews.author: Cody w.

customer_reviews.title: Totally devastating broadhead.
customer_reviews.text: I was a die hard fixed blade user. i read numerous reviews on this broad head so I figued I would give them a try. Let me tell you these things are no joke. I would classify them as the 300 win. mag. of the broadhead world. I shot two deer so far with them. One dropped on the spot with a gapping hole behind both shoulders. The second went 20 yards with a two foot solid swath of blood from the point of impact to recovery. No fixed blade has ever done that for me. They are out and this broadhead is in end of story.
customer_reviews.author: robert p. fiorito

customer_reviews.title: I really love these blades
customer_reviews.text: I really love these blades. First shot I took was straight on. Not a shot I would normally take but it was all I had and I was confident the blade would handle it. A 20 yd tracking job proved I was right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Practice Head
customer_reviews.text: These may be the best on the market, I don't know, I haven't used them yet. I'm very disappointed that there was no practice head included as stated in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Kenn

customer_reviews.title: ... the quick humane harvest no long tracking you can easy harvest game without wounded it
customer_reviews.text: These broaheads are no joke that fly true and get the quick humane harvest no long tracking you can easy harvest game without wounded it .vitals are the target that’s why you need a broad head that flies true these Rage broad heads haven’t failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: First day of archery season I took a 40 yard shot from a tree stand. Flight was very true. After passing through my target the broad head embedded at least 2" into a thick root. 5th day took another from 70 yards. Flight was just as true with full pass through.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: Have tried the product yet they seem to be fine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my crossbow for deer hunting, they have just arrived and the description says it comes with practice tip which it did not. This has nothing to do with quality of broadhead, but i. Just tired of companies say one thing about their product and delivering something else!
customer_reviews.author: robin Deboser

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best. I have tried many others and these are ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best. I have tried many others and these are just the right weight and my barnett Jackal loves throwing them. Pros: .Even weight distribution. .Huge cut for a good blood trail. .Comes with practice broadheads. Cons: .Plastic rings break easily. .Given the design they can be hard to mount on your bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better...
customer_reviews.text: Hands down... The best crossbow broadhead I've ever used. Huge wound channels. Perfect flight. I watched my arrow pass through the deer, and the deer walked by me (I thought I missed). The deer walked 15 yards ... Sat down... Looked around for a couple of minutes and laid down and died within 15 mins. It never knew what happened. My shot took the bottom of the heart off.
customer_reviews.author: All things through Christ

customer_reviews.title: these do a great job on a fast kill very impressed along with ...
customer_reviews.text: these do a great job on a fast kill very impressed along with the blades stay put while hunting most of the other fixed blades i have tried one minute there in place the next there open really makes a hunter mad when that happens so all i have or use is Rage there a beast of a broad head .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slayers-Practice head included-these rock-DEAD DEER
customer_reviews.text: Slayed several deer with these last year and one so far this year. I have a 10pt turbo crossbow that is one of the highest FPS bows I have stayed with the 10pt bolts and these heads and the combo ROCKS. Also one of the things that’s awesome about these is they send you a perfectly weighted practice target head to dial in your bow in practice. Buy these you won’t be mad/sad !
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shoe

customer_reviews.title: Broken blades.
customer_reviews.text: Shot 2 deer ,1 doe and 1 3year old bu ck. Both within 30 yds broadside in chest cavity. Complete pass through on both. 1 head had no blades on head and the other had 1 partial blade still attached. Both deer went under 80 yards but very little blood trail. Chest cavity on both were full of blood but exit holes were extremely small. 1 hit a rib and one hit 2 ribs. I have used Rage since they first came out on my Mathews compound and camnot say enough about their great performance. Can't say that these crossbow heads match that performance.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT accurate
customer_reviews.text: purchased 100 grain. They were not accurate for me. Zeroed with bolt tip @ 40 yards. @ 40 yards these were all over the target. Specifically 10" low @ 40 yards. Double checked and package purported it to be 100 grain. Will NOT purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: R.P. 164 in Mo

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve seen in 30 years
customer_reviews.text: Most deadly broad heads I’ve ever used. Dropped a deer. Ripped 4 inch hole on the back end. I’ve never seen anything like this. AAA plus.. I’ve hunted for over 30 years..
customer_reviews.author: James T. Vesche

customer_reviews.title: Improve your packaging when shipping
customer_reviews.text: The clear package was thrown in a box to bounce around. When it arrived the tips were out of the molded compartments and the blades were exposed and hitting each other. These need to be factory sharp. I change them after every shot. I will have to check and or change these blades too! Poor quality creates waste and expense!!
customer_reviews.author: Catbird

customer_reviews.title: A broad head I'll be using for life.
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but great luck with these broad heads. I have successfully used them for deer and bear hunting. I'm not sure if using a crossbow helps more with the deployment of the mechanics, but they operated as described.
customer_reviews.author: C.M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hunting!
customer_reviews.text: My sweetie got his buck on the second day of bow hunting this season with these accurate and swift broadheads. He loves them; best he's ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: They Fly like a field tip
customer_reviews.text: Took my first deer this season with one. Only went about 35 yards. They Fly like a field tip! I like the extra ( was shooting 100 gn) weight forward. The practice tip is very helpful , but it does get caught up in the bag on removal most times. One note of caution: the sharp edge of the blades is exposed. Different then other mechanicals I have used. I changed my quiver and it doesn't come p quite as high so there is a real (I cut my finger in the dark one AM) chance of an accident. I absolutely recommend and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris farrugia

customer_reviews.title: No practice head
customer_reviews.text: Do you plan on seeing if it works with your bow before using it? Well sorry pal. This says it comes with a practice head but does not.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: Don't want to waste one!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get a practice one, and don't want to waste one in my target, so I haven't even tried them. My son says they're good, so that's what I have to go on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Rage X...Devistation in the air
customer_reviews.text: Killed 2 bucks and 1 doe never saw such devastation. Been bow hunting for over 45 yrs. farthest tracking 30 yards max. Was hesitant with mechanicals because of poor design and even worse engineering of other heads. Practice heads are right on...just buy them and use them. Good hunting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Practice Head
customer_reviews.text: The description says that it comes with a practice head. Can't find anyway to contact the seller
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ive ever used
customer_reviews.text: I got comments from multiple people on multiple deer using these. Butcher asked if i cut him open with a knife and my dad said it looked like a hole from a bullet. Deer didnt make it far at all
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: It is a killing machine
customer_reviews.text: I have used this broadhead twice and both times taken the deer home. The head seems to fly very close to the field bolts. And makes a very good cut at 25 yards and 51 yards. I am very happy with this broadhead.
customer_reviews.author: Tony McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Missing practice tip
customer_reviews.text: I have used these with great success and not so great success. Sometimes they open sometimes they don't. Black collars are to weak for my crossbow which is a Horton Furry. Red collars dont always open. I love the flight path and grouping! My complaint is it clearly says practice tip included and there was not one In the package. I have 125 grain from a set i bought last year but switched to 100 grain and was expecting the tip i paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Mom38

customer_reviews.title: Flies true, and bolts went completely through me deer at 40 yards.
customer_reviews.text: Flies true, and bolts went completely through me deer at 40 yards. Blades bend after 1 shot, so seems like a 1-time use. Flies true, and bolts went completely through me deer at 40 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wow just wow
customer_reviews.text: Got my very first deer today. Through and through both lungs. That deer was shooting blood 5 ft from both sides for 40 yards. Best experience ever. Just hope a helicopter doesn’t fly over because my backyard looks like a murder scene. Oh yeah rage for life.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kors

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Real accurate, opens every time and makes a large cut that brings the animal down quick and leaves a good blood trail. I'll never use any other broadhead.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Cosner

customer_reviews.title: Fake!
customer_reviews.text: These seem fake. There's no authentication sticker inside which is standard for all Rage Broadhead products.
customer_reviews.author: John Owen

customer_reviews.title: Make sure they give you one free practice tip when you buy 3 broadheads.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of assuming all rage broad heads come with practice heads included,should send them back since my 12 year old twins need them because of missing both targets and deer. Won’t buy again with out them included. Rage wants the same price for practice tips. I’m now set for 6 deer and three years and they saved me at least 120 bucks or more. I have a whole bunch of muzzy broad heads they now get to burn up
customer_reviews.author: Geoff wNAME_NOT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: These will not group out of my center point crossbow. 8" plus group shooting out of a lead sled. Now where close to the field points. With field tips can shoot the same hole, and at 60 yard have 2" group.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Son got his second deer with this broadhead. Big enterence/exit holes for good blood trails and quick expire of the animal which is just what we all want. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Pinstriper

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: No instructions in package, but YouTube solved the problem. The device worked perfectly, bringing down a spike buck who ran about 75 yards and collapsed. The skin would was over two inches in length and the blood trail easy to follow. It worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: George Anast

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown in picture.  Different shock collars
customer_reviews.text: Please do not use this product. I used Rage Crossbow X broadheads and they were great. Rage changed their shock collars to be stronger (orange high energy shock collars). THESE DO NOT ALLOW BALDES TO DEPLOY!!! I shot through two different targets and neither head deployed. Unfortunately I had to order a set of the old shock collars on top of these already expensive broadheads
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Broadheads.
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a long time. All the new ones come with the red collars which i switch to black because my xbows dont shoot fast enough to deploy blades with the red collars. Would be 5 stars if these still came with the purple/blue collars they used too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: They come together easy. My dad has used these for years and has had a lot of success. I hope I get to use one this year.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Again another product falsely advertised and sold on AMAZON. No practice tip as advertised in bullet points. REALLY WISH AMAZON would have a policy that the customer is refunded a portion of the cost if product is not 100% as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: No Practice
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. Archery season has started. They arrived very fast.... that earned it a 3 star. However, like other reviewers, there was no practice tip included. The company needs to start supplying them or take it off the description.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: great purchase, instructions need some improvement for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars only because as a beginner, I had to You Tube to properly install the broadhead on my arrow as the alignment of the blades on the plastic/rubber grommet was a bit confusing in the instructions provided.
customer_reviews.author: Carl R

customer_reviews.title: No practice tip! The description is wrong!
customer_reviews.text: They don’t actually include a practice tip! Now I have to spend an extra $30 because of FALSE ADVERTISING.
customer_reviews.author: JustSomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: No practice tip included, utterly useless without it.
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt come with a practice tip, utterly useless without the ability to see how it effects trajectory. Description clearly states that it comes with one too.
customer_reviews.author: Codebreaker1003

customer_reviews.title: Not sold yet
customer_reviews.text: I like what these are designed to do, while sighting in a couple time they have not expanded. I hope that never happens if I shoot at a deer.
customer_reviews.author: Harley hunter

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer
customer_reviews.text: Killed my biggest buck ever with this broadhead, a 165" gross 14 point. Hit it high and back but within a few hours time, I was able to retrieve it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: I cannot risk that again so will be returning this season to fixed which unfortunately usually shatter upon impact - hate that too
customer_reviews.text: Lost 2 big bucks last season because the broad head did not open...not sure why they are stuck closed? I cannot risk that again so will be returning this season to fixed which unfortunately usually shatter upon impact - hate that too, but at least they make the kill.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Doetsch

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT come with the practice broadhead...
customer_reviews.text: I just received these broad heads and there is no practice broadhead in the packaging. The advertisement is false. I would have liked to know this before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Peterock

customer_reviews.title: No joke
customer_reviews.text: These fellas are serious broadheads. They get the job done very effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Kreider

customer_reviews.title: Get's good penetration and a large entry and exit wound
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for several years. Get's good penetration and a large entry and exit wound.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome broadheads
customer_reviews.text: I have shot several deer with these. Goes straight through almost every time and leaves massive damage. I highly recommend them. Btw, I use a crossbow, if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these broadheads. I shot three deer with these last year and none of them ran more than 75 yards with a blood trail that was easy to follow because of the large wound opening . They fly true and the practice tip flies like the real tips.
customer_reviews.author: dp3408

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Flew flat and true. Took a doe at 30 yards, sounded like it got hit with a baseball bat. Only ran 20 yards. Exit wound was almost 3 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Becca K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic performance
customer_reviews.text: Performed flawlessly against a great whitetail and a hog. Shots were well placed but not perfect but YIKES the tracking trails were obvious and game down very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieBTX

customer_reviews.title: Great, sharp, spreads well and does a super job
customer_reviews.text: Works well. This is all my husband uses for deer hunting and they do enough damage to drop the deer quick so it doesnt suffer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Switched over to mechanical from fixed broadheads. I gained accuracy and confidence. Shot my first deer with these broadheads this week. Deer didn't make it 40 yards and piled up. The blood loss was remarkable. Likes: accuracy and results. Absolutely destroyed the deer. Dislikes: have to buy extra shock collars, practice tip provided, did not shoot exactly like the broadhead. Forced me to us a real broadhead for practice. Final verdict: great broadhead and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: megan galando

customer_reviews.title: Went through the deers spine and through the stomach!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fly perfect like a fixed broadhead out of my killer instinct 380. Sad it didn’t come with the practice tip. Overall good quality and price!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: They do the job!
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey, but they do the job on deer and they fly true @420fpt. I’d recommend to everyone who shoots a crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderHeart

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: First off they do not come with a practice tip. second I took one out of the package shot it into a glen del target and it broke. third they do NOT fly like field points! I can take my field point and place it ANYWHERE I want, the broad heads shoot all over the place! CRAPPY product! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: harold bruce

customer_reviews.title: Work good so far
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my crossbow and they fly like field points
customer_reviews.author: Country railroader

customer_reviews.title: Didn't open
customer_reviews.text: Shot a doe today and it didn't open. Going back to swhacker.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Parker

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend anything else if hunting big
customer_reviews.text: Rage are very reliable, have had many elk and deer taken with them. Would not recommend anything else if hunting big game
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: No practice tip as described
customer_reviews.text: Description states a free practice head comes with tips. That is not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding performance and very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding performance and extremely durable. I have reused the same broad head several times. It is still in service.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blood trails GALORE!
customer_reviews.text: Really can't say enough how much I like these broadheads. 2019 will be my second year using them and have NO reason to change my set up. So far I haven't had any issues at all. Never question "Is that a drop?" again! Lol, seriously they lay that sh*t open!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Deer die
customer_reviews.text: The deer die easily when hit by this great work
customer_reviews.author: leeman7957

customer_reviews.title: not where i aimed
customer_reviews.text: yeah i killed the deer, but it was not where i aimed. when i found the arrow back only one side opened up and my flight path was arched. aimed for the heart at 20 yards and slit the neck almost missing. will go back to fixed broadheads.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Duling

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the collar system but they were lethal at 13 yards and flew the same as the field tips. I'm not a Rage Fanboy but these worked great so far. The crossbow bolt broke and I did not find the broadhead end after shooting a deer so I can't speak to the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Ben and Renee

customer_reviews.title: expensive but works great
customer_reviews.text: these rage broadheads are expensive but work great. love the included practice broadhead
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Lomax

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: Haven't witnessed their effectiveness yet but they came highly recommended by my crossbow hunting friends
customer_reviews.author: kevin mcauliffe

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Item Description
customer_reviews.text: Item description says it includes "Includes free practice head." IT DOES NOT! Deceptive seller. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Broadhead
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great broad head I’ve used so many different ones and these by far are more accurate and do great for putting deer on the ground but they do not come with practice head even tho it says they do
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Rage Crossbow X, 2-Blade Archery Arrow Broadhead, 100 or 125 Grain with Shock Collar Technology (3-Pack)
feature_bullets: PRECISION - Rage broadheads are known for their accuracy and their legendary wound channels
MASSIVE CUTTING SURFACES – Rear-deploying, SlipCam design with huge leading-edge blade and razor sharp .035" thick stainless steel expandable blades; 2" cutting diameter; 100 Grain

TECHNOLOGY - Improved Shock Collar Technology ensures proper blade retention while bolt is stored & in-flight and allows for broadhead to open upon impact – Aluminum Construction FERRULE ALIGNMENT TECHNOLOGY
3 PACK - 100 grain broadhead. Also available in 125 grain. Replacement blade R53005 (not included); Made in the USA
RAGE - Leading the Evolution in Mechanical broadheads
Shock Collar for proper blade retention

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
